attribute.name: CarrierLabelID
attribute.comment: A unique system assigned identifier for the Carrier Label

attribute.name: CarrierLabel
attribute.comment: The Carrier supplied label which is affixed to the Parcel

attribute.name: TrackingID
attribute.comment: A tracking number provided by the service provider who actually delivers the shipment.

attribute.name: TrackingURL
attribute.comment: A URL to the service provider's website, which allows interested parties to track the shipment.

attribute.name: CheckReferenceNumber
attribute.comment:
A reference code used by the carrier to verify the customer. This is printed on the label.
This is usually the last 4 digits of the customers credit card.

attribute.name: DPI
attribute.comment: The Dots Per Inch of the Image or PDF attached.

attribute.name: FileFormatTypeCode
attribute.comment:
Identifies a digitial file format.
Exmples include: mpeg jpeg QuickTime flashvideo

attribute.name: FileFormatName
attribute.comment: Business name for the FileFormatType

attribute.name: FileFormatExtension
attribute.comment: File extension typically used to designate a file as this type of file format.

attribute.name: VendorID
attribute.comment: A unique system assigned identifier for the Vendor.

attribute.name: ParcelID
attribute.comment: A unique system assigned identifier for the Parcel.

attribute.name: ParcelBarCode
attribute.comment: This holds the bar code scanned and associated with a parcel when the ordered item/items are placed in a parcel for delivery.

attribute.name: ParcelStatus
attribute.comment: This records the status of a parcel.

attribute.name: ValueForInsurance
attribute.comment: The declared insurable value of the item(s) in the parcel. This value is used as part of the business rules for carrier selection.

attribute.name: DropSequenceNumber
attribute.comment: This is a sequencial (alpha-numeric) number assigned to each of the parcel drops on a given delivery route.

attribute.name: DeliveryDate
attribute.comment: The actual delivery date

attribute.name: ProofOfDeliveryFlag
attribute.comment: Set if proof of delivery is required for the parcel.

attribute.name: DimensionID
attribute.comment: A unique identifier for a given set of dimensions on an object.

attribute.name: Height
attribute.comment: Defines the height of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in linear-measure-unit-codes.

attribute.name: Width
attribute.comment: Defines the width of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in linear-measure-unit-codes.

attribute.name: Depth
attribute.comment: Defines the depth of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in linear-measure-unit-codes.

attribute.name: Length
attribute.comment: Defines the length of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in linear-measure-unit-codes.

attribute.name: Volume
attribute.comment: Defines the cubic volume of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in 'VolumeUnitOfMeasure' codes.

attribute.name: Weight
attribute.comment: Defines the weight of a object (i.e. parcel/box/pack/etc.) in weight-measure-unit-codes.

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureCode
attribute.comment: The code used to specify the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken. This code relates to the UCC data element 355.

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureTypeCode
attribute.comment: Indicates what this unit of measure entity type instance measures. Examples include weight or mass, length, cube (length x width x depth), volume, discrete items (each), etc.

attribute.name: EnglishMetricFlag
attribute.comment:
Indicates whether this unit of measure is part of the English (i.e. 'Imperial') or Metric system of measurements.
0 - English (i.e. 'Imperial', the default) 1 - Metric

attribute.name: Name
attribute.comment: Name assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.comment: Description assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: RetailTransactionLineItemSequenceNumber
attribute.comment: The sequence number of line item within the context of this RetailTransaction.

attribute.name: ItemLookupMethodCode
attribute.comment: A mnemonic code denoting which code was used to enter the Item into the RetailTransaction e.g. POSIdentity, POSIdentiyAndQualifier, ItemID, POSDepartmentID.

attribute.name: ItemType
attribute.comment: Meta-Data denoting the kind of item being sold (or returned) in the line item e.g. StockItem, ServiceItem, AggregateItem, etc.

attribute.name: SubItemType
attribute.comment: Meta-Data denoting the kind of StockItem or ServiceItem being sold (or returned) in the line item e.g. FuelItem, BulkItem, ApparelItem, RentalItem, MiscellaneousFee, etc.

attribute.name: RegularUnitPrice
attribute.comment: The regular or lookup per-unit price for the item before any discounts have been applied.

attribute.name: RegularUnitPriceQuantity
attribute.comment: The number of units applicable to the regular or lookup-up price of the Item at the time of the Transaction e.g. 3 for 99c

attribute.name: ActualUnitPrice
attribute.comment: The actual per-unit price paid by the customer for this particular sale. It is obtained by applying applicable price derivation rules to the regular unit price.

attribute.name: ActualUnitPriceQuantity
attribute.comment:
The number of units applicable to the actual per-unit price paid by the customer for this particular sale.
e.g. 3 for 87c

attribute.name: Quantity
attribute.comment: The number of retail selling units sold to or returned by a customer. For services the number of units (e.g. hours or job) sold or in the case of refunds, reduced to zero revenue.

attribute.name: Units
attribute.comment:
The number of units sold, when selling bulk merchandise.
Eg: A sale of 20 Gallons of Gas: Quantity=20, Units=1, UnitOfMeasure=Ga
Eg: A sale of 3 cans of Beans: Quantity=3, Units=3, UnitOfMeasure=Ea

attribute.name: ExtendedAmount
attribute.comment: The product of multiplying Quantity by the retail selling unit price derived from price lookup (and any applicable price derivation rules). This retail sale unit price excludes sales and/or value added tax.

attribute.name: UnitDiscountAmount
attribute.comment: The monetary total per-unit of all Discounts and RetailPriceModifiers that were applied to this Item

attribute.name: ExtendedDiscountAmount
attribute.comment: The monetary total of all Discounts and RetailPriceModifiers that were applied to this Item

attribute.name: ItemIDEntryMethodCode
attribute.comment: A code that describes how this line item's item identification is being entered (e.g. it is scanned, keyed SKU, keyed department, etc.)

attribute.name: SellUnitRetailPriceEntryMethodCode
attribute.comment: A code that describes how this line item's retail selling unit price is being entered (e.g. it is manually keyed, obtained from price lookup, etc.)

attribute.name: SellUnitRetailPriceDerivationMethodCode
attribute.comment: A code that documents how the selling unit retail prices were derived for this line item.

attribute.name: ActionCode
attribute.comment: A code denoting how the item is being treated in the line item.

attribute.name: UnitCostPrice
attribute.comment: The unit cost of the Item to the retail enterprise at the time of the Transaction.

attribute.name: UnitCostPriceQuantity
attribute.comment: The number of units applicable to the cost of the Item to the retail enterprise at the time of the Transaction e.g. 3 for 99c

attribute.name: UnitListPrice
attribute.comment: The unit MSRP of the Item at the time of the Transaction

attribute.name: UnitListPriceQuantity
attribute.comment: The number of units applicable to the MSRP of the Item at the time of the Transaction e.g. 3 for 99c

attribute.name: InventoryValuePrice
attribute.comment: The value per unit of the Item taken from the StockLedger at the time of the Transaction.

attribute.name: InventoryValuePriceQuantity
attribute.comment: The number of units applicable to the value per unit of the Item taken from the StockLedger at the time of the Transaction e.g. 3 for 99c

attribute.name: GiftReceiptFlag
attribute.comment: A flag denoting that an abbreviated GiftReceipt was issued for this LineItem. This may mean that return processing will be different if the item is returned. (Yes=1, No=0)

attribute.name: ISOCurrencyCode
attribute.comment: Currency code designated by ISO to identify national currency

attribute.name: ISOCurrencyNumber
attribute.comment: Numeric code assigned by ISO to identify national currencies

attribute.name: ISOCurrencyName
attribute.comment: ISO designated currency name

attribute.name: RetailerAssignedCurrencyTypeCode
attribute.comment: Retailer assigned currency code that may be used as an alternate key.

attribute.name: Symbol
attribute.comment: National symbol for the main unit of currency, e.g. Â£, $, etc

attribute.name: CostNODecimals
attribute.comment: Contains the number of decimals (allowed after the point) supported by the currency for costs (buying perspective).

attribute.name: RetailNODecimals
attribute.comment: Contains the number of decimals (allowed after the point) supported by the currency for retail selling.

attribute.name: ISOCountryCode
attribute.comment: The ISO-3166-1 two letter code denoting a locality (at Country level) in which the retailer does business.

attribute.name: CountryName
attribute.comment: The name of a locality (at Country level) in which the retailer does business.

attribute.name: ISO3166ThreeCharacterCountryCode
attribute.comment: ISO designated three character abbreviation for a country, This code is usually more closely related to the country name than the alpha-2 code.

attribute.name: ISO3166ThreeNumberCountryCode
attribute.comment: ISO designated three digit abbreviation/codification for a country,

attribute.name: ISO3166FourCharacterCountryCode
attribute.comment: ISO designated four character abbreviation for a country, Also known as 'Formerly used codes' this four-letter country code represents a country name that is no longer in use. The structure depends on the reason why the country name was removed from ISO 3166-1 and added to ISO 3166-3.

attribute.name: UserDefinedCodeFlag
attribute.comment: A Boolean flag to indicate if this is a user (JL) defined country codification. Yes (=1), No (=0). 'No' will be the default. Specific ISO codes are set aside by the ISO for this express purpose.

attribute.name: PrimaryCountryOfOriginFlag
attribute.comment: Indicates whether the country is the primary country for the item\supplier Or Manufacture origin. Valid boolean values are Y(=1) and N(=0).

attribute.name: ShipmentLineItemSequenceNumber
attribute.comment: A unique, non-significant, automatically assigned sequential number used to identify this item within the context of the RetailTransactionShipment.

attribute.name: Quantity
attribute.comment:
Denotes how many of the items in the relevant SaleReturnLineItem are to be delivered in this shipment.
The implication being that one may purchase more than one of an item in a single SaleReturnLineItem and each instance of the item purchased may be shipped to a different address.

attribute.name: ItemID
attribute.comment: A unique system assigned identifier for the retailer's SKU.

attribute.name: PriceLineID
attribute.comment: A unique identifier for this price point.

attribute.name: SubBrand
attribute.comment: A sequence number that identifies a subbrand within a brand.

attribute.name: AuthorizedForSaleFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag to indicate that the RETAIL STORE is authorized to stock this particular ITEM. Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: DiscountFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag to indicate whether this ITEM can be discounted. Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: PriceAuditFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag to denote whether this ITEM was validated (scanned) during verification of the ITEM table. Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: TaxExemptCode
attribute.comment: A code to denote the tax exemption status from sales and use tax. The codes refer to the UCC code, Tax Exempt Code, defined in data element 441.

attribute.name: UsageCode
attribute.comment:
This code defines how this item may be used within a store, web site (i.e. virtual store) or other JL business unit / location. Usage is a function of how an item may be consumed or disposed of by the store.
Valid item usages include: SALES: Sales - the item may be sold SUPPLY: Supply - the item is for internal consumption and may not be sold DISPLAY : Display - the item is intended to present merchandise on the sales floor BOTH: Both - Item may be sold AND/OR consumed as a supply item
In instances where an item usage is stated as 'Both', an accounting transfer transaction will be required to change the "usage state" of the items consumed/used from a retail item to a supply item for accounting purposes.

attribute.name: Name
attribute.comment: The preferred JL name by which the Item is known. All non-preferred names are deemed 'aliases'.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.comment: The textual description of the Item and its characteristics.

attribute.name: LongDescription
attribute.comment: A longer textual description of the Item and its characteristics.

attribute.name: ItemSubTypeCode
attribute.comment: This code indicates which subtype this item is. Examples are Stock Item, Aggregate Item, Service Item, Prepared Item, Group Select Item, etc.

attribute.name: ConfigurableItemFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag that indicates whether the product is a configurable product (e.g M2M -'Made To Measure', ASAF-'Any Shape,Any Fabric'). Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: KitSetCode
attribute.comment: This code signifies this ITEM is provided as a kit which has to made up either by the customer or by the store at an additional cost.

attribute.name: NumberOfBoxes
attribute.comment: The number of boxes, parcels, or lots that make up one StockItem. Some products may be packaged in several lots e.g. a table might have the top and legs wrapped separately. Used for delivery planning and ensuring all component parts are moved together (to a DC, Customer Delivery Hub, etc). Default value will be one unit.

attribute.name: SubstituteIdentifiedFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag to indicate an ITEM for which there is a substitute available for sale within the RETAIL STORE. Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: OrderCollectionCode
attribute.comment: A code to signify that this ITEM is ordered as part of a collection of ITEMs.

attribute.name: SerializedIUnitValidationFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag used to identify if the SERIALIZED ITEM requires operator validation after payment has been made and prior to customer pickup. Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: SupplierOrderableFlag
attribute.comment: A boolean flag that indicates if the product published is a 'directly' supplier orderable product/service or not. Covers items such as 'giftcards' which can be created on demand! Yes (=1) and No (=0).

attribute.name: OrderableFlag
attribute.comment: Indicates if the item is an Orderable item (Yes=1, No=0).

attribute.name: ItemUnconstrainedFlag
attribute.comment:
A boolean flag that denotes whether the Item (which can be a StockItem, ServiceItem, etc) has constrained/unconstrained 'supply (availability). "1" Unconstrained (aka 'infinite' supply) "0" Constrained (i.e. 'finite' supply).
An 'unconstrained StockItem level' is informed by one (or more stock suppliers).
An 'unconstrained ServiceItem' is more complex to assess e.g, for 'installation services e.g. installing a washing machine, kitchen, etc)' there might be resource/time constarints in delivering the service, whereas for warranty ServiceItem(s), these would be truly 'unconstrained. A JL business assessment may make the final call on how this indicator is set.

attribute.name: RetailVerticalCategoryCode
attribute.comment:
An identifier for the type of product/item categorisation type.
ARTS identifies this as a category code for retail vertical (e.g. GROCERY, HME_IMPRVMT, APPRAL, AUTOPARTS, etc.)

attribute.name: CollectionIndicatorFlag
attribute.comment: Indicates if the Item is a collection(pack) or not

attribute.name: BuyingInstructions
attribute.comment: Notes for the Buying Team to leave each other

attribute.name: CreateDateTime
attribute.comment: The Date and Time when this item was created. This value should only be set on creation and should never subsequently be changed.

attribute.name: OrderAsType
attribute.comment: Indicates whether the Item is ordered individually or as a collection

attribute.name: JLExclusiveFlag
attribute.comment:
This identifies a product that a supplier is making available to ONLY John Lewis. This could be for a specified or limited period.
Is the Item exlusive to JL or NOT? (Yes=1, No=0).

attribute.name: ItemLifeCycleStatus
attribute.comment:
Shows the life-cycle status of the item at a point in time.
Candidates could include: Ready for Ordering Ready for Selling No Further Purchase Orders Awaiting Deletion of SKU

attribute.name: ItemComments
attribute.comment: Comments about the Item (required for RMS)

attribute.name: CostLineID
attribute.comment: A unique identifier for this cost point.

attribute.name: PlannedExpiryDate
attribute.comment:
Identifies if the product has a planned expiry (discontinuation) date. This will influence activities such as product replenishment, clearance sale, etc.
This date is NOT to be confused with the expiry date that may apply to perishable (e.g. food) products to indicate use by, eat by, etc.

attribute.name: ForecastableFlag
attribute.comment: Indicates if JL wishes to apply forecasting algorithms for any purposes

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureCode
attribute.comment: The code used to specify the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken. This code relates to the UCC data element 355.

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureTypeCode
attribute.comment: Indicates what this unit of measure entity type instance measures. Examples include weight or mass, length, cube (length x width x depth), volume, discrete items (each), etc.

attribute.name: EnglishMetricFlag
attribute.comment:
Indicates whether this unit of measure is part of the English (i.e. 'Imperial') or Metric system of measurements.
0 - English (i.e. 'Imperial', the default) 1 - Metric

attribute.name: Name
attribute.comment: Name assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.comment: Description assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureCode
attribute.comment: The code used to specify the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken. This code relates to the UCC data element 355.

attribute.name: UnitOfMeasureTypeCode
attribute.comment: Indicates what this unit of measure entity type instance measures. Examples include weight or mass, length, cube (length x width x depth), volume, discrete items (each), etc.

attribute.name: EnglishMetricFlag
attribute.comment:
Indicates whether this unit of measure is part of the English (i.e. 'Imperial') or Metric system of measurements.
0 - English (i.e. 'Imperial', the default) 1 - Metric

attribute.name: Name
attribute.comment: Name assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.comment: Description assigned to this unit of measure.

attribute.name: CarrierShipmentTypeID
attribute.comment: A unique, retailer supplied identifier for the carrier assigned to the Retail Transaction Shipment.

attribute.name: CarrierShipmentTypeName
attribute.comment: A unique, carrier supplied identifier for the shipment type.
